summary: The Department of Veterans Affairs spends billions of dollars annually to buy goods and services that serve veterans. However, VA's contracting staff must contend with policies that are out of date, as well as a complicated organizational structure, to fulfill their mission. VA also can't take full advantage of discounts for medical supplies due to issues such as obsolete systems. To address these concerns, we...
title: Veterans Affairs Contracting: Improvements in Policies and Processes Could Yield Cost Savings and Efficiency
